intro: Eclipta erecta, commonly known as false dandelion, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It features a branching stem that is often hairy and grows up to 1 meter in height. The plant produces small, yellow composite flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and have a rough texture with prominent veins. Eclipta erecta is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
